Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Summary: seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst on contract to provide analytics support across various business domains.

In this role, you will develop proficiency with data infrastructure and reporting tools (AWS Redshift, MicroStrategy) and independently lead analytics projects.

You will analyze customer transaction data, assess the impacts of marketing campaigns and product features, identify trends, and deliver clear, data-driven insights to stakeholders across business functions such as operations, product, and finance. You will collaborate closely with internal and external teams, presenting well-supported conclusions and visualizations.




Responsibilities:

Lead Analytics Projects: Independently gather requirements, identify relevant data, and write sophisticated SQL scripts to build data sets that enable you to generate insights through visualizations and presentations.

Provide Analytics Support Across Business Functions: Deliver actionable insights for Lifecycle marketing, business development, operations, product, and finance to drive strategic initiatives. Analyze Customer Transaction Behavior. Support analytics on customer transaction behavior, particularly for new product features and user adoption, to identify patterns and trends that align with business goals.

Create Visualizations and Dashboards: Design impactful visualizations and automated dashboards to reveal key trends and measure the effectiveness of various initiatives, from marketing to product launches.

Investigate Data Anomalies: Proactively investigate data anomalies and idiosyncrasies, uncovering underlying issues and opportunities that haven’t been explicitly requested

Exceed Partner Needs: Leverage your knowledge of the business to anticipate and exceed partner needs, using initial requirements as a foundation and building upon them with novel insights

Collaborate Across Teams: Work with internal and external stakeholders to define and deliver data, reports, visualizations, and dashboards critical to decision-making.

Ensure Data Quality: Maintain high data quality through rigorous documentation and quality assurance processes.

Drive Projects with Minimal Guidance: Take ownership and accountability for meeting contribution goals, consistently pushing projects forward independently.

Required Qualifications:

Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, economics, physics, or a related quantitative discipline.
4+ years of data analytics experience, ideally within a financial services or business analytics context.
Advanced SQL proficiency, including expertise with window functions, common table expressions (CTEs), performance tuning, and query optimization for Large data sets.
Proven experience working with cross-functional data in marketing, product, finance, or operations.
Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation using tools such as Micro Strategy, Tableau, Power BI, Looker, QuickSight, or Excel.
Familiarity with statistical methods and experience using R or Python for in-depth data analysis.
Proactive Mindset: A natural problem-solver who identifies and investigates data inconsistencies or patterns, uncovering insights that drive business impact.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to explain complex analyses to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills, capable of transitioning from detailed analysis to high-level strategic insights
Ability to influence and drive alignment through constructive dialogue without formal authority
Flexibility in prioritizing tasks, selecting appropriate tools, and managing multiple projects with competing priorities.
Strong relationship-building skills and a desire to collaborate in a high-energy, team-oriented environment

Preferred Qualifications:

Financial Transaction Data Analysis: Experience in analyzing and mining financial transaction data for insights, with an understanding of payment technologies, payment types, credit/debit card networks, and purchase authorization/settlement processes.

Data Science and Modeling: Experience in building and deploying predictive models (regression, classification, clustering, time series forecasting) using Python, R, or similar tools.

Machine Learning: Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and their application in deriving insights from large datasets

Cross-Functional Analytics Expertise: Experience working on projects across multiple business areas such as marketing, product, finance, and operations translating data into actionable business insights

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Amsterdam | 40 hours




Urban Gym Group is an industry pioneer within the European wellness and fitness community, with over 40 clubs and studios in major cities across the Netherlands and The United Kingdom. You might know us from brands such as Trainmore, ClubSportive, Renessence, BTY CLB, TRIB3, PILAT3S and Gymbox. Our ambitious domestic and international growth plans require an expansion of our Business Intelligence team.




We are looking for a highly motivated and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will play a key part in driving our data-driven decision-making, making a significant impact on our continued success. Working closely with our Finance, Marketing, and Analytics teams, you will extract valuable insights from our data, helping us optimise operations, enhance member experiences, and support our ambitious growth plans.




Key responsibilities:

Conduct market research and analyses to identify new club locations.
Develop business cases for club expansion, including new builds, mergers, and acquisitions.
Build ETL processes to structure data from various sources for business use.
Create data views, tables, and reports supporting daily operations and strategic goals.
Design dashboards that enable informed, data-driven decisions.
Analyze growth to identify high-performing areas and new opportunities.
Query databases for insights on key metrics like revenue and member retention.
Use data to boost member retention, inform marketing strategies, and support revenue growth.




You:

2 to 4 years of experience in a data-focused role (e.g., Data Analyst, Data Engineer, or BI Specialist).
Proven expertise in data pipeline creation, data visualization, and analytics.
Industry experience in fitness/wellness or retail is preferred, with insights into customer retention, revenue optimization, and business expansion.
Advanced proficiency in SQL with a strong understanding of Azure SQL.
Hands-on experience building ETL pipelines, ideally using Python or Azure Synapse Analytics.
Proficient in Power BI, with a track record of designing impactful dashboards and reports.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you an experienced Data Analyst with experience in the Insurance sector?




We are currently looking for an experience data analyst with experience in the Insurance Industry. As a Data Analyst at thewave you will work on interpreting data, analyzing results, and providing insights to aid decision-making for our clients within the Insurance Sector. They typically work with large volumes of data, often using statistical techniques and software tools to uncover trends, patterns, and correlations. Our Data Analysts are instrumental in helping our clients understand their data, identify opportunities, and solve problems.




Overall, our Data Consultants play a crucial role in helping organizations derive actionable insights from data to drive business growth and decision-making. They combine technical expertise with business acumen to turn raw data into meaningful information that drives strategic initiatives and improves operational efficiency.







What do we offer?

Passion & fun

Besides our passion for insurance we believe in having fun from time to time, since happier employees perform better. Prepare for regular team updates & events and an exciting yearly calendar closing event (CCE)!




Training & Coaching

We strongly believe in training and coaching. Each employee receives a coach and a series of interesting trainings. We expect however the employee to play a pro-active role in this, outlining and managing his/her own career path. This may include taking internal responsibilities in a young company with ambitious growth plans.




Compensation & Benefits

We offer a full compensation & benefits package, consisting of an interesting salary, a motivating bonus scheme, representation and lunch allowances, eco-cheques, a cool company car with international fuel/electric card, a public transport subscription, a laptop, a deluxe smartphone and a hospitalization & group insurance.




What will you be doing?

1. Data Collection and Processing:

Gather data from various sources such as databases, spreadsheets, and APIs.
Clean and preprocess data to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Organize and structure data for analysis.




2. Data Analysis:

Apply statistical methods and analytical techniques to interpret data.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in the data.
Perform exploratory data analysis (EDA) to discover insights.
Conduct hypothesis testing and statistical inference.




3. Data Visualization:

Create visualizations such as charts, graphs, and dashboards to communicate insights effectively.
Use tools like Tableau, Power BI, or matplotlib for data visualization.
Design visually appealing and informative reports for stakeholders.




4. Reporting and Presentation:

Prepare reports and presentations summarizing findings and insights.
Communicate complex technical concepts in a clear and understandable manner.
Present findings to stakeholders, including management and non-technical audiences.




5. Data-driven Decision Making:

Collaborate with teams across the organization to understand business requirements.
Provide data-driven recommendations and insights to support decision-making processes.
Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to track progress and performance.




6. Continuous Learning and Improvement:

Stay updated on emerging trends, tools, and technologies in data analysis.
Enhance analytical skills through training, certifications, and hands-on experience.
Share knowledge and best practices with colleagues to foster a culture of learning.




What do you need to bring?

Proficiency in SQL for data querying and manipulation.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong experience within the Insurance Industry.
Experience with statistical analysis and data visualization tools.
Familiarity with programming languages such as Python or R.
Knowledge of data warehousing concepts and data modeling.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Knowledge of Dutch and/or French, and English
Attention to detail and ability to work independently.
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field such as statistics, mathematics, computer science, or related disciplines. A master’s degree or certifications in data analysis or related fields may be preferred.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Background




You will be driving the development of data products for delivering digital solutions for circular services in the Digital Circular Ventures team.
Our vision is to transform into a circular business by 2030, through developing customer facing circular services for the many.
Currently we have three services in our portfolio: a Peer-to-Peer marketplace, Buyback & Resell and As-Is Online.
You will work in Data & Analytics together with Data Engineers, Data Analysts, and Data Scientists. Together, you will be joining cross-functional teams consisting of colleagues from Engineering, Product and Design (PEDX), to design, implement and deploy products at scale. Your job will be a mix of understanding business needs, designing data solutions – and of course writing code.




Requirements:




A strong background in analytics, computer science, econometrics or equivalent (at least MS or equivalent).
Proven experience as a data analyst, with a minimum of 4 years in a mid-level role.
Marketing analytics. At least 2-3 years experience with (digital) marketing data, analyzing and optimizing campaigns to drive better targeting, channel mix and conversion. Agency background preferred.
Digital product development through Data Analytics.
Enjoy figuring out how to use math, code and data to derive insights from large datasets in order to solve real-life, fast-paced business problems.
Ability to translate complex findings into actionable insights for business stakeholders.
Experience with Google Analytics + Big Query or similar web analytics tools.
Experience with Optimizely or similar A-B testing tool preferred.
Proficient in data visualization tools (preferably Power BI).
Experience working with large datasets and databases.
Solid understanding of statistical concepts and methodologies.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Hands-on and positive attitude.
Detail-oriented with strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
Familiarity with data governance and data quality best practices.
Experience with dbt and Google Cloud is a plus.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Sobre Newlink 💛

En Newlink generamos el engagement que las organizaciones, las marcas y las personas necesitan en este mundo hiperconectado y en constante cambio.

Somos +500 profesionales cuyo Propósito Compartido es crear conexiones de valor, que activamos sobre tres dimensiones: Reputación, Marca y Cultura Organizativa.




¿Cuál será tu misión? 🕵🏼

Como Data Analyst del Departamento de Operaciones, tu misión será recopilar, organizar y transformar datos para apoyar la toma de decisiones estratégicas de la organización. Al comprender las necesidades del negocio y las capacidades tecnológicas disponibles, este analista deberá contribuir con la mejora de la eficiencia operativa y reducción de costos, proporcionando soluciones innovadoras que impulsen los objetivos de negocio.




Principales funciones:📋

Recopilación y análisis de datos, asegurando precisión y calidad.
Extracción de información de bases de datos, sistemas ERP, CRM, hojas de cálculo, APIs o herramientas especializadas.
Examinar patrones y tendencias en los datos utilizando técnicas estadísticas y analíticas.
Identificar problemas o áreas de mejora dentro del negocio.
Generar sistemas de visualización y reportes.
Crear dashboards, gráficos e informes interactivos para comunicar insights de forma clara y comprensible.
Ofrecer soporte para la toma de decisiones mediante reportes basados en datos.
Proporcionar recomendaciones estratégicas basadas en datos a los líderes de la organización.
Contribuir a formular estrategias en áreas clave como marketing, ventas, operaciones y finanzas.
Aportar en la automatización de procesos.
Diseñar procesos y herramientas que automaticen la recopilación y análisis de datos.
Implementar soluciones que faciliten el acceso a la información en tiempo real.
Control, supervisión, organización y mejora de las herramientas de la compañía, tanto internas como de proveedores externos.
Ser el owner de herramientas de la organización en coordinación con HQ.




¿Qué estamos buscando? 🔎

Título o formación en Administración de Empresas con especialización en Data Analytics, o en áreas como Estadística, Economía o Finanzas con un enfoque en análisis de datos u otras disciplinas afines.
Experiencia demostrable con herramientas de BI (Tableau, Power BI, Domo, iDashboards, etc.) y gestión de proyectos de análisis de datos.
Perfil junior (1 a 3 años de experiencia).
Alto nivel de inglés.

Se valorará positivamente:

Certificación en herramientas de BI o tecnologías relacionadas.
Experiencia en el manejo de herramienta Notion.
Experiencia en consultoría o en entornos de comunicación.




¿Qué te ofrecemos? 🤝🏼

Contrato indefinido a tiempo completo.
Modalidad híbrida: nuestro flexiworking es 3x2 (3 días presenciales y 2 días de teletrabajo).
Horario de 9:00 a 18:00 y viernes de 9:00 a 15:00.
Actividades internas de Team Building, Newlink Balance y Recognition Program.
Fruta dos días a la semana (lunes y miércoles).
Referral Program: si recomiendas a una persona que cumpla con el perfil que buscamos, recibirás un bonus.
Programa de incentivo de nuevo negocio: por referir clientes recibirás un bonus.
Plan de Retribución Flexible.




¿Cómo será tu proceso de selección? 💻

Antes de nada, aplica a la vacante 😊
Llamada telefónica inicial: si cumples los requisitos, desde el equipo de People nos pondremos en contacto contigo para conocernos y comentar la oferta.
Entrevista con el equipo: queremos que conozcas al equipo, tus roles y responsabilidades, así como clientes principales.
Caso práctico: si has llegado hasta aquí es porque el equipo quiere verte en acción ¡demuestra todo lo que sabes!
Entrevista presencial: qué mejor forma de decir que sí que viéndonos trabajar y conocer nuestras oficinas.

No te preocupes, durante todo el proceso, el equipo de People estará en contacto contigo.




Si has llegado hasta esta parte, es porque de verdad te interesa, ¡no dudes en aplicar! Además, es solicitud sencilla 😊

Protiviti is a multinational management consulting group, a leader in the analysis and design of Governance, Organization, and Control models. For our Milan office, we are seeking determined and proactive individuals who understand both our clients' businesses and the technologies they use. You'll be part of our multi-disciplinary Digital team from day one, making impactful contributions.

Managing end-to-end Data Analytics / Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
Running data identification, extraction and transformation (ETL)
Connecting Data Analytics / Process Mining tools to client’s IT systems
Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards

Identifying bottlenecks and areas of improvement
Leveraging on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to automate improvements

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated, self-starting, Data Analyst with a passion for solving mysteries and puzzles with data to join our fast-growing team.

About The Role

If you're excited about using AI to push the boundaries of data analysis, this is the perfect opportunity for you. You will be responsible for uncovering actionable insights, driving decision-making, and transforming raw data into compelling stories that shape our future!


Champion the integration of AI across all teams, using it to uncover actionable insights and accelerate the process of turning business questions into solutions.
Identify patterns, trends, and insights within large datasets to inform strategic decisions. Utilise statistical methods and data visualisation tools to effectively communicate findings and support data-driven decision-making across the organisation.
Tasked with enhancing customer-facing analytics to empower our customers and partners in making data-driven decisions, ultimately aiming to boost overall platform performance.
Work closely with various departments, including marketing, operations, and finance, to drive both efficiency and revenue growth.


You’ll love it here if...


You adapt quickly to technological changes and enjoy staying at the forefront of new technologies to enhance your skills and effectiveness.
You’re a self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and loves to be involved in every step of the process from definition to delivery.
You’re often seen with your sleeves rolled up, diving into whatever needs to be done to achieve the mission.


What You’ll Be Responsible For


Supporting the implementation of the self-service analytics strategy by ensuring high data reliability, clarity, and thorough structure and documentation. This will empower non-technical stakeholders to independently address their business questions through dashboards, intuitive data access, and an AI capable of interpreting our data.
Conducting exploratory data analysis, extracting valuable insights on the performance of diverse user segments and their interaction patterns with our product. This involves delving into extensive datasets, applying statistical methods, and using data visualisation tools to identify significant trends and correlations.
Standardising and improving dashboards to ensure a consistent and professional presentation of data for external audiences, while enhancing the scalability and adaptability of the reporting system to meet the evolving needs of our stakeholders.
Proactively communicate with relevant stakeholders, providing regular updates on the status of the business question pipeline. Share insights into the roadmap prioritisation process and ensure transparency in decision-making.


About You


Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or a related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R
Experience with Metabase, Power BI, Tableau or another BI tool
4+ years working on a data-driven role at a consulting firm, finance or high growth startup/scaleup
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in developing and maintaining data pipelines using DBT or related technologies
Experience with AWS services such as redshift and S3


What We Offer


Competitive Compensation including employee equity scheme
Unlimited Annual Leave
Health Insurance
Paid Family Leave
Hybrid Working

The BI Analyst will need to combat a lack of standardization, centralization, and consistency in data availability by developing repeatable frameworks for accessing and analyzing data to develop actionable insights regarding the state of the business.

Performance relative to market

Support for business and strategic decisions

Standardized, regular cadence of confident reporting, accelerating/reducing delivery timeframes
Data-driven prioritization and decision making (both strategic and opportunity-specific)

Meaningful customer segmentation


Work closely with key business partners and stakeholders to ensure data is consistently and accurately reconciled between various data sets (when needed)

Experience in Excel (including Pivot tables, lookups, charts, functions etc.)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Mission:

As part of the Customer Operations & Finance department and key member of the Contact Forecasting Team, your role will be to analyze customer interactions across all touchpoints and predict their future behavior, based on expected or planned events. You will collaborate closely with Customer Operations, Digital, Marketing, Finance, and Sales teams, contributing to initiatives that impact on customers and on their contact behavior. Your work will ensure accurate impact assessments and effective planning of related activities.







Key Responsibilities:

Analyzing customer base and contact behavior by customer type, product, channel, seasonality
Generating insights to identify pain points and opportunities to enhance the customer journey
Producing rolling forecasts for customer contacts across all interaction channels (both human and digital)
Monitoring and analyzing deviations between actual customer behavior and forecasted trends
Presenting key findings and insights to management on customer behavior and digital engagement, along with identified opportunities







Requirements

Analytical background: at least 3 years’ experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst
Ability to interpret business needs and translate them into analytical approaches that drive reliable results
Strong experience with cloud-based Data Lake environments and data management
Proficiency in SQL for querying and data management

Title: Junior Consultant - Process Data Analyst
Description:
Protiviti is a multinational management consulting group, a leader in the analysis and design of Governance, Organization, and Control models. We help our clients explore new opportunities for development and value growth by identifying risks and defining the best management and control strategies. We have a significant international presence, with 80 offices and over 10,000 employees worldwide. In Italy, we have been operating since 2004 with 450 employees.




For our Milan office, we are seeking determined and proactive individuals who understand both our clients' businesses and the technologies they use. You'll be part of our multi-disciplinary Digital team from day one, making impactful contributions.




Role Overview




We are looking for graduates in technical disciplines who will join our Digital team and launch their career within the Product & Service Industry (es: Food and Beverage, Manufacturing, Construction, Automotive..). You will support all the phases of Data Analytics and Process Mining projects:




Managing end-to-end Data Analytics / Process Mining initiatives across various clients and industries
Running data identification, extraction and transformation (ETL)
Connecting Data Analytics / Process Mining tools to client’s IT systems
Designing and developing process monitoring dashboards
Analyzing and interpreting the findings
Identifying bottlenecks and areas of improvement
Leveraging on Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence to automate improvements
Drawing actionable conclusions and recommendations




Required Technical Skills & Experience:




Graduate in Statistics, Applied Math, Economics, Information Management, Computer Science, Management Engineering or related fields
Hands-on experience with one or more Data Analytics (Power BI, Qlik, Tableau, etc) and Process Mining tools (Celonis, Signavio etc.)
Skills in data manipulation and/or scripting (SQL, Python)
Able to understand various data structures and common methods in data transformation
Experience in process analysis and improvement




Nice to have:




1-2 years of experience in leading consulting firms or in leading international system integrators as a Data Scientist or Data Engineer or Data Analyst:
Familiarity with at least one enterprise suite (SAP, ServiceNow, Oracle etc.) is a big plus
Functional knowledge of financial and/or business processes (Procurement, Sales, Accounting, Logistics…)




Basic requirements in the selection are the excellent knowledge of the Italian and English languages (both oral and written), interpersonal and communicative skills, experience of team management and relations with company management as well as ability to travel based on client requests/commitments.

Title: Junior/ Mid Data Analyst with Python
Description:
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

Job Description

Verisk Underwriting Solutions (UWS), a unit of Verisk Analytics (VRSK), provides technology rich solutions in Underwriting to the Property & Casualty insurance industry. These advanced analytical solutions address challenging problems related to risk and decision-making in P&C insurance underwriting. We combine vast data resources with cutting-edge technology to create innovative and technically rigorous solutions.

Verisk Analytics, a NASDAQ100 company, is a leading source of information about risk. We offer risk-assessment services and decision analytics to professionals in insurance, healthcare, mortgage, government, risk management, and other fields. In the United States and around the world, Verisk Analytics helps customers protect people, property, and financial assets. To learn more about Verisk Analytics and UWS, please visit www.verisk.com and http://www.verisk.com/underwriting/ respectively.

About The Team

The work environment at UWS is fast paced, fun, and informal. The work is challenging and rewarding and you will be working with a diverse group of highly professional individuals. We value and recognize excellent work, encourage innovative and creative thinking, yet also emphasize the importance of an appropriate work/life balance. Our team is comprised of professionals with advanced degrees and experience in a variety of disciplines. This creates an exceptional opportunity for collaboration and growth by drawing upon the knowledge and experiences of a truly diverse and highly skilled team.

About The Position

We are currently seeking to fill the position of Data Analyst at UWS, a unit within Verisk Analytics. The ideal candidate is highly inquisitive, organized and detail oriented, and can think strategically and will be able to learn our business logic.

The Data Analyst position will be responsible for various analytical, operational and project management related duties and will learn and apply auto insurance fundamentals. The position will regularly perform ad-hoc analyses to research internal/external inquiries and to identify systemic issues or improvements and help guide strategic decisions using tools such as: SQL, Python, PowerBI and Excel. Position is responsible for conducting Proof of Concept tests with customers, showing the value of our products to prospective clients. The team is also responsible for helping create value add recurring reports for various areas within the organization (product, operations, sales) and performing ad-hoc data analysis

Responsibilities:


POCs: Developing, Managing, and Executing customer Proof of Concept (POC) tests and other projects. This includes the creation of reusable Python & SQL modules for conducting batch data appends, as well as interfacing with Product, Sales & Operations on customer requirements
Reporting: Create recurring and ad-hoc reports, both internal and customer-facing, using Excel, Python/SQL, PowerBI (e.g. financial reports, scorecards, dashboards). Position would be responsible for end-to-end process (ETL of data, data cleaning, summarization of data, creation of report/visualization)
Analysis: Analyzing large data sets and making recommendations based on findings (Data Quality, Product Enhancements/Inquiries, A/B Testing, Data Integration)
Create and maintain documentation that will support the effective implementation of repeatable processes, workflows and understanding of supported products & data (e.g. data dictionaries, processing instructions, internal product knowledgebase)
Identify and implement opportunities for process improvement/efficiencies (e.g. Automation, Data Quality Checks)
Performing QA on internal team development as needed
Becoming a product expert in our various underwriting solutions
Working closely with our various teams in the US (both East and West Coast)


Qualifications


Bachelors Degree with at least 1-5 years of applied experience
Degree should be in a quantitative field such as Math, Economics, etc. or applicant must have equivalent past work experience
Experience using Python to extract, transform and analyze data required (1+ years’ experience)
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Experience managing projects with aggressive timelines
Ability to juggle multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment
Knowledge of relational database concepts
Excellent verbal & written communication in English; ability to distill complex concepts into language that is understandable and compelling to business decision makers
Detail oriented and well organized
Experience using SQL to query and analyze data required (1+ years’ experience) is astrong asset
Proficient with Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, working knowledge of Outlook, Teams, OneNote, and Visio a plus
Familiarity with XML & JSON data formats and a plus
Familiarity with PowerBI, Tableau a plus
Property/Casualty insurance experience a plus


Additional Information

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companiesand by Forbesas a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions— provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions— supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions— offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions— provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions— provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions— delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions– offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft— provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

The position will regularly perform ad-hoc analyses to research internal/external inquiries and to identify systemic issues or improvements and help guide strategic decisions using tools such as: SQL, Python, PowerBI and Excel. Position is responsible for conducting Proof of Concept tests with customers, showing the value of our products to prospective clients. The team is also responsible for helping create value add recurring reports for various areas within the organization (product, operations, sales) and performing ad-hoc data analysis

Responsibilities:

  • POCs: Developing, Managing, and Executing customer Proof of Concept (POC) tests and other projects. This includes the creation of reusable Python & SQL modules for conducting batch data appends, as well as interfacing with Product, Sales & Operations on customer requirements
  • Reporting: Create recurring and ad-hoc reports, both internal and customer-facing, using Excel, Python/SQL, PowerBI (e.g. financial reports, scorecards, dashboards). Position would be responsible for end-to-end process (ETL of data, data cleaning, summarization of data, creation of report/visualization)
  • Analysis: Analyzing large data sets and making recommendations based on findings (Data Quality, Product Enhancements/Inquiries, A/B Testing, Data Integration)
  • Create and maintain documentation that will support the effective implementation of repeatable processes, workflows and understanding of supported products & data (e.g. data dictionaries, processing instructions, internal product knowledgebase)
  • Identify and implement opportunities for process improvement/efficiencies (e.g. Automation, Data Quality Checks)
  • Performing QA on internal team development as needed
  • Becoming a product expert in our various underwriting solutions
  • Working closely with our various teams in the US (both East and West Coast)

Qualifications

  • Bachelors Degree with at least 1-5 years of applied experience
  • Degree should be in a quantitative field such as Math, Economics, etc. or applicant must have equivalent past work experience
  • Experience using Python to extract, transform and analyze data required (1+ years’ experience)
  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
  • Experience managing projects with aggressive timelines
  • Ability to juggle multiple projects and priorities in a fast-paced environment
  • Knowledge of relational database concepts
  • Excellent verbal & written communication in English; ability to distill complex concepts into language that is understandable and compelling to business decision makers
  • Detail oriented and well organized
  • Experience using SQL to query and analyze data required (1+ years’ experience) is astrong asset
  • Proficient with Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, working knowledge of Outlook, Teams, OneNote, and Visio a plus
  • Familiarity with XML & JSON data formats and a plus
  • Familiarity with PowerBI, Tableau a plus
  • Property/Casualty insurance experience a plus

Additional Information

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companiesand by Forbesas a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Underwriting Solutions— provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions— supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions— offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions— provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are looking for a highly motivated, self-starting, Data Analyst with a passion for solving mysteries and puzzles with data to join our fast-growing team.

About The Role

If you're excited about using AI to push the boundaries of data analysis, this is the perfect opportunity for you. You will be responsible for uncovering actionable insights, driving decision-making, and transforming raw data into compelling stories that shape our future!


Champion the integration of AI across all teams, using it to uncover actionable insights and accelerate the process of turning business questions into solutions.
Identify patterns, trends, and insights within large datasets to inform strategic decisions. Utilise statistical methods and data visualisation tools to effectively communicate findings and support data-driven decision-making across the organisation.
Tasked with enhancing customer-facing analytics to empower our customers and partners in making data-driven decisions, ultimately aiming to boost overall platform performance.
Work closely with various departments, including marketing, operations, and finance, to drive both efficiency and revenue growth.


You’ll love it here if...


You adapt quickly to technological changes and enjoy staying at the forefront of new technologies to enhance your skills and effectiveness.
You’re a self-starter who thrives in ambiguity and loves to be involved in every step of the process from definition to delivery.
You’re often seen with your sleeves rolled up, diving into whatever needs to be done to achieve the mission.


What You’ll Be Responsible For


Supporting the implementation of the self-service analytics strategy by ensuring high data reliability, clarity, and thorough structure and documentation. This will empower non-technical stakeholders to independently address their business questions through dashboards, intuitive data access, and an AI capable of interpreting our data.
Conducting exploratory data analysis, extracting valuable insights on the performance of diverse user segments and their interaction patterns with our product. This involves delving into extensive datasets, applying statistical methods, and using data visualisation tools to identify significant trends and correlations.
Standardising and improving dashboards to ensure a consistent and professional presentation of data for external audiences, while enhancing the scalability and adaptability of the reporting system to meet the evolving needs of our stakeholders.
Proactively communicate with relevant stakeholders, providing regular updates on the status of the business question pipeline. Share insights into the roadmap prioritisation process and ensure transparency in decision-making.


About You


Bachelors in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Engineering, or a related field
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Python, or R
Experience with Metabase, Power BI, Tableau or another BI tool
4+ years working on a data-driven role at a consulting firm, finance or high growth startup/scaleup
Ability to present complex information in a clear and concise manner


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in developing and maintaining data pipelines using DBT or related technologies
Experience with AWS services such as redshift and S3


What We Offer


Competitive Compensation including employee equity scheme
Unlimited Annual Leave
Health Insurance
Paid Family Leave
Hybrid Working

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO WE ARE...

Our Mission is to help those in need with our out-of-this-world superpowers. Avalanche Laboratory's purpose is to be a reliable and long-term business partner to our customers offering them customized software solutions tailored for their business processes. We work on a project basis (in the EU and beyond), to this day we have already implemented over 320 projects and currently, we are working on another 45 projects. We have a wide range of clients from the financial sector, fintech, government projects, manufacturing companies etc.




WHAT WE DO

We are set up to provide our customers with end-to-end support in the process of developing software solutions:

Business need analysis, design of functional and non-functional requirements, system analysis, support for business transformation and IT/business consultancy;
User interface and experience design and development for mobile and desktop applications;
Front and back-end development in a wide range of technologies: Java, .NET, Ruby, GoLang, Oracle, Python.
Complete Data Warehouse solutions from architecture, design and implementation using mainly Vertica, Oracle and Microsoft platforms.
Avalanche has been the central counterparty for multiple major banking projects in the Scandinavia and Baltics, in areas such as lending automation, regulatory reporting and calculations, integrations, governance, risk and compliance, Basel II/III, Stress Testing, AML/KYC.




Do you like us already? Wait until you see the role 😊

You will have an amazing opportunity to work with an experienced and constantly growing team. Your first project in Avalanche Labs will be in the Banking industry.




DO YOU HAVE...

🚀 Previous work experience in data analysis;

🚀 Data query skills (SQL);

🚀 Understanding of database modeling and design;

🚀 Database design experience.




WHAT YOU'LL DO...

🚀 Analyze, define and document business data requirements;

🚀 Define, manage and publish business terms, definitions and rules for data elements

🚀 Monitor and report data quality;

🚀 Analyze data quality issues' root causes and evaluate their business impact;

🚀 Resolve issues where possible, escalate where necessary, and propose improvement activities;

🚀 Test systems and data (from a business perspective) during IT System acquisition or changes.




WHY BECOME AN AVALANCHER...

⭐ This is an opportunity to work with talented teammates and shape the future of Avalanche Labs (and we have daring plans!)

⭐ Working on an international level in a fast-paced environment with professional growth opportunities

⭐ Benefit basket with additional health insurance plan, options to get the latest tech, additional vacation weeks, training, travel around Europe in a camper van, go on extreme adventures with Avalanchers, and much more!

⭐ Excellent quarterly company events and monthly themed events!

⭐ Flexible work time and hybrid or remote work arrangements and other perks.

⭐ Salary range in this position is up to 5000 eur gross based in LT.
